derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English peonie, via Latin from Greek paiōnia, from Paiōn, the name of the physician of the gods

entry.def: A peony is a medium-sized garden plant which has large round flowers, usually pink, red, or white.

means.word_mean: 1. any of numerous plants widely cultivated for their showy single or double red or pink or white flowers

auth_sentence.content: Key plants include peony Paeonia 'Claire de Lune', Trollius 'Cheddar' and Iris chrysographes 'Black Form'.
